oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Use of Individual Cow Somatic Cell Counts and Bulk Tank Samples to Monitor Herd Mastitis Status
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hueston, William D.
Heider, Lawrence E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: somatic cell count (SCC)
bulk tank samples
mastitis
individual cow
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: With the advent of automated cell counting, there has been a proliferation of milk somatic cell count (SCC) data for bothbulk tank samples and individual cows. The optimal use of this data in monitoring mastitis is still being debated. Thepurpose of this paper is to discuss the use of SCC data from both individual cow and bulk tank samples for monitoringmastitis on a herd basis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1984; 119-122
